prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing anniversary greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Anniversary card for my wife Meiling who is sweet and lovely. Her cooking is the best I like so much and so thankful. She likes Lotso bear be with her. Hope she is always smiling and happy!"
Style: ðŸ“» Retro Vintage
Tone: ðŸ’• Romantic - sweet and loving
To: Meiling
From: Hank
Message: "Love you my darling!"

Reference: "Turn her into cartoon style while the face is recognizable "

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the sweet and loving tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way


- Include romantic elements like soft lighting, hearts, flowers, or intimate scenes



- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "anniversary" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in retro vintage style with 1950s-60s aesthetics, classic typography, warm nostalgic colors, and mid-century design elements

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a anniversary card with sweet and loving tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in retro vintage style with 1950s-60s aesthetics, classic typography, warm nostalgic colors, and mid-century design elements

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Love you my darling!" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in retro vintage style with 1950s-60s aesthetics, classic typography, warm nostalgic colors, and mid-century design elements

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in retro vintage style with 1950s-60s aesthetics, classic typography, warm nostalgic colors, and mid-century design elements

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card with a retro vintage, 1950s-60s aesthetic. The art style is a stylized 2D cartoon illustration with a warm, nostalgic color palette dominated by muted yellows, teal, and soft browns, with subtle pink accents. The scene depicts a cheerful, cartoon-style woman with dark brown hair, round glasses, and a wide smile, wearing a brown jacket, a patterned scarf with teal and orange hues, and teal pants. She is kneeling in a kitchen setting with teal cabinets and pastel pink drawers. She is holding a heart-shaped cake decorated with piped frosting. To her right sits a small, cute, peach-colored plush bear. The background features kitchen elements like a stove and a countertop with a jar, all rendered in a flat, illustrative style. Sunlight streams in from the right, casting diagonal shadows on the floor. The text \"Happy Anniversary\" is prominently displayed at the top in a charming, flowing, brown handwritten cursive font, perfectly integrated with the retro aesthetic. The overall mood is sweet, loving, and joyful.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card with a retro vintage, 1950s-60s aesthetic, maintaining the same warm, nostalgic color palette of muted yellows, teal, and soft browns. This is a simple, decorative element that complements the front cover's theme without any text or people. The design features a subtle, artistic motif, perhaps a stylized heart or a pattern inspired by the scarf worn on the front, rendered in a delicate, illustrative style. The decoration is concentrated towards the center and left side of the card, leaving the bottom-right corner clear for a QR code. The overall mood is serene and provides a gentle artistic closure to the card's visual story, with a subtly creative and memorable touch.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior page of a greeting card, continuing the retro vintage, 1950s-60s aesthetic with the established warm, nostalgic color palette. This page allows for complete creative freedom, focusing on developing the visual story with innovative and unexpected elements, without any people or characters. The design could be a charming, stylized illustration of a cozy kitchen scene, perhaps focusing on the heart-shaped cake and the warmth of home, or it could be a more abstract composition of patterns and motifs inspired by the scarf and the overall 1950s-60s design language. The aim is to evoke a sweet and loving tone through visual storytelling, creating something unique and memorable that harmonizes with the front cover and the overall card theme. Text can be placed safely in the center area, if any is desired, in a coordinating retro font.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior page of a greeting card, designed to be the story's climax with the message \"Love you my darling!\". It maintains the retro vintage, 1950s-60s aesthetic and the established warm, nostalgic color palette. The message \"Love you my darling!\" is written in a beautiful, clearly readable, elegant handwritten cursive script, evoking a personal and heartfelt tone with natural ink flow. This script is integrated into innovative and sophisticated decorative artwork that frames the message. The artwork goes beyond typical florals and patterns, presenting something genuinely special and artistic, perhaps incorporating subtle nods to the kitchen setting or the plush bear in an abstract way, without featuring any people. The overall composition is designed to be visually engaging and emotionally resonant, acting as the emotional peak of the card experience."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a retro vintage style, featuring a subtle continuation of the story from the front and interior. The artwork is flat 2D, full-bleed with a warm, slightly textured cream-colored background. Faint, thin mint green grid lines are subtly present, evoking a kitchen counter. In the upper left quadrant, a teal blue, stylized heart-shaped cookie cutter is present, casting a soft, light green shadow. To its right, a vintage wooden rolling pin with rich brown handles lies diagonally, also casting a soft, light green shadow. Scattered around these elements are a few small, soft pink dots, resembling sprinkles or fallen flour. The overall composition is minimalist and peaceful, offering a quiet resolution. The bottom-right corner, approximately 1 inch square, is intentionally left clear and undecorated to accommodate a QR code. The artistic style is consistent with the front and interior, utilizing warm nostalgic colors and mid-century design elements, with a focus on clean lines and gentle shading. This design provides a complementary and serene ending to the card's narrative.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a retro vintage style, featuring a whimsical, flat 2D illustration on a teal background. The composition is a playful, dense arrangement of various kitchen utensils and baking tools, rendered in a limited color palette of soft pastel yellow, pale pink, and cream. Utensils include whisks, spatulas, rolling pins, spoons, forks, and mixing bowls. Scattered amongst the tools are small, simple motifs of pink hearts and stylized asterisk-like stars, adding a touch of sweetness and charm. The overall aesthetic is reminiscent of mid-century illustration, with clean lines and a slightly textured, aged paper feel. The elements are oriented in various directions, creating a dynamic yet harmonious pattern.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a vintage, retro aesthetic. The background is a soft, creamy beige. The main focus is the handwritten message "Love you my darling!" in a rich, dark brown, elegant, flowing cursive script. Above the message, two stylized, light peach-colored hearts are positioned as if floating or being sent. Below the message, a graceful, wavy, light brown motif resembling stylized steam or flowing ribbon descends vertically, taking up the right-center portion of the page. The overall design is clean, with ample white space for writing, and evokes a sweet, romantic, and nostalgic feeling, fitting a 1950s-60s style.
